Articles.Content:
I've been playing KSP for a number of years and haven't come across a problem I couldn't address myself, except for now. I can no longer bring up the Hack(?) sheet, like for infinite fuel, through Alt+F12 for a while. I'm in version 1.0.2 using windows 8.1, and with lots of memory and graphics muscle. Any thoughts? Even if I might be in the wrong section.

Edited January 11, 2016 by Glasher
Added text

Is it a Steam download? Have you checked if you have the overlay enabled, and perhaps you have Alt-F12 in Steam bound to something?

In Steam, Settings menu, in-Game... maybe you have the screenshot set to Alt-F12? Or one of the other key bindings.

 

Or check the settings of KSP itself... it is possible to rebind Alt-F12 to something else, I think.

Edited January 12, 2016 by swjr-swis

OSX?  Linux?  Windows?

The shortcut is different on the different platforms, so it'd help to know which you are using.

But do make sure your alt and F12 keys aren't being used by some other program, and that they aren't stuck/broken.

swjr-swis ,I first picked this game up when it was free and before I knew Steam existed and received all version upgrades through KSP. But I will look into the Steam settings anyway (I value all opinions) and double check the KSP settings as well.

The F12 key does work in other instances so a broken key isn't an issue.

Thanks

 

sal_vager   asked, " OSX?  Linux?  Windows? The shortcut is different on the different platforms, so it'd help to know which you are using."

4 hours ago, Glasher said:

 I'm in version 1.0.2 using windows 8.1, and with lots of memory and graphics muscle.

Am holding back on repeat answers. Thank you for you time, sal_vager, it's appreciated!

 

Edited January 12, 2016 by Glasher

Glasher, does your keys require pressing Fn + F12 instead of just F12?

If so, i suggest you press Fn + Alt + F12. If it doesn't work, then it's probably another issue.

1 hour ago, Rdivine said:

Glasher, does your keys require pressing Fn + F12 instead of just F12?

If so, i suggest you press Fn + Alt + F12. If it doesn't work, then it's probably another issue.

Rdivine, I never could bring up the Debug Toolbar with just F12 (Notice I use the correct name now?) only Ctrl+F12. BUT.... Your suggestion of Fn + Alt + F12 did work, though only now with several fast repeating pressing of all three keys. Go figure. Thank you Sir, now I can push on with my rescue of Bob, Jeb and Bill!

Thank you all for your helpful effort!
